title: 10 sets of 10 coins
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Five pirates have obtained 100 gold coins and have to divide up the loot. The pirates are all extremely intelligent, treacherous and selfish (especially the captain)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The captain always proposes a distribution of the loot. All pirates vote on the proposal, and if half the crew or more go "Aye", the loot is divided as proposed, as no pirate would be willing to take on the captain without superior force on their side."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If the captain fails to obtain support of at least half his crew (which includes himself), he faces a mutiny, and all pirates will turn against him and make him walk the plank. The pirates start over again with the next senior pirate as captain."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the maximum number of coins the captain can keep without risking his life?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The captain says he will take 98 coins, and will give one coin to the third most senior pirate and another coin to the most junior pirate. He then explains his decision in a manner like this..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If there were 2 pirates, pirate 2 being the most senior, he would just vote for himself and that would be 50% of the vote, so he's obviously going to keep all the money for himself."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If there were 3 pirates, pirate 3 has to convince at least one other person to join in his plan. Pirate 3 would take 99 gold coins and give 1 coin to pirate 1. Pirate 1 knows if he does not vote for pirate 3, then he gets nothing, so obviously is going to vote for this plan."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If there were 4 pirates, pirate 4 would give 1 coin to pirate 2, and pirate 2 knows if he does not vote for pirate 4, then he gets nothing, so obviously is going to vote for this plan."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As there are 5 pirates, pirates 1 & 3 had obviously better vote for the captain, or they face choosing nothing or risking death."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10 Statements about Calculus, Oh My...
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Each of the following statements have an assigned value to it. You are to determine whether the statement is true or false. Each statement has a value assigned to it, which happens to be the powers of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2^n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the statement number. The sum of values associated with the true statements, can be expressed as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ABC"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Evaluate "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4A + B - 3C"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I. All continuous functions are integrable, where defined."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"II. All integrable functions are differentiable, where defined."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"III. All differentiable functions are integrable, where defined."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"IV. All functions that have a finite surface area must have a finite volume. Do not consider any degenerate figures or special cases of a three dimensional function."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"V. All functions that have an infinite surface area must have an infinite volume. Do not consider any degenerate figures or special cases of a three dimensional function."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"VI. A functions whose integral diverges must have a discontinuity or an asymptote on its graph."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"VII. A function whose integral diverges will also have its summation diverge, where defined."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"VIII. A function of x, whose improper integral converges can be shifted to the right by a factor of a/x, where a > 0, and will still converge, so long as it has the same bounds as the original integral."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"IX. A summation and a definite integral operator can always be interchanged."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"X. A differential operator and a definite integral operator can always be interchanged."}]}]}

title: 10 Stones
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/x4MXiEbaR0-10stones.png?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Ten stones all have distinct weights."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"They are randomly labeled A through J."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The stone labeled B is weighed against all the other stones except J, and found to be heavier than all of them except A."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The probability that J is heavier than B is given as "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{a}{b}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are coprime positive integers."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There's a lot of "noise" in this problem.  To clear the noise, note that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A, J > B > C \mbox{ through } I"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" just means ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the heaviest or the second heaviest"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Out of 10 stones, what is the probability that we would choose either the heaviest or the second heaviest stone to be our "J"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Answer: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{2}{10} = \frac{1}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b = 1+5 = \boxed{6}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are three possible orderings of the stones (heaviest to lightest):"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB \to"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" rest"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AJB \to"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" rest"}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"JAB \to"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" rest"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number of ways of achieving each one is:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"bulletList","content":[{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AB \to"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (rest): "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 8!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"AJB \to"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (rest): "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 7!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"listItem","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"JAB \to"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (rest): "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 7!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, the probability that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J>B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is heavier than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") is given by:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P = \frac{7! + 7!}{7! + 7! + 8!} = \frac{2 \cdot 7!}{2 \cdot 7! + 8 \cdot 7!} = \frac{2}{10} = \frac{1}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+5 = \boxed6"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yeah, this is a much more interesting/involved problem...  I must admit that when I wrote this problem I hadn't realized that I was just saying, "What is the probability that J is the heaviest or second heaviest?"  which is trivially 1/5.  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Lemme think about your question for a bit...

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            This makes me think of another question ...."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose we are told instead that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the stones have distinct weights and that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" have the same weight, (distinct from the other "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"), with all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" possible "equal-pairings" being equally likely. If as before "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A \gt B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is greater than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C \to I"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", what is the probability that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J \gt B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with this added condition? Is it less, the same, or greater than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1/5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"?"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I think that the complication here is that there is an asymmetry in the possible equal-pairings left after the initial set of weighings. We have eliminated "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"15"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"45"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ("},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with 8 of the others and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" with 7 of the others, (and with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as well but we've already counted that one)). 9 of the 30 pairings left can involve "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so there is a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1/30"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" chance of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" being paired with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and the same of it being paired with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". There is then a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"21/30 = 7/10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" chance that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"'s weight is distinct, in which case there are 9 positions in the weight order it can be placed in, (as in this case 2 of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"C \to I"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are paired), leading to a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2/9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" chance that it weighs more than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The final probability that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"J\ \gt B"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is then"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{9}{30} \times \dfrac{1}{9} + \dfrac{21}{30} \times \dfrac{2}{9} = \dfrac{17}{90} \lt \dfrac{1}{5}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Does this sound reasonable? My concern is the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2/9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" value; it might be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2/10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", but either way the final probability is less than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1/5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". This did make me think of another question, but I'll leave that for another time. :)

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 10 tangents, 20 feets!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P'_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" be the feet of perpendiculars drawn from foci "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S'"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on a tangent "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T_i"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the ellipse "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"E: \dfrac{x^2}{a^2} + \dfrac{y^2}{b^2} = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" whose length of major axis is 40 units. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \ \displaystyle \sum_{i=1}^{10} (SP_i)(SP'_i) = 2560"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"100e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details:","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"'"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"e"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"' denotes the eccentricity of the ellipse."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simply use the property that product of length of perpendicular from the focii to any tangent is b^2"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"so b^2 = 256  b = 16 and a = 20"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"simply e = 3/5"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10 teams. How many games?
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A football league has 10 teams. Each team plays with every other team thrice - once on their home ground, once on the opponent teams ground and once on a neutral venue. How many matches will be contested in the league?"}]}]}

title: 10th
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the sum of the first 10 whole numbers?"}]}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Or you could use the formula "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{n(n+1)}{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

replies.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Correct! Do not have the first whole number, becuse -1234576489764945 is a whole number smaller than -2 and -3.26958*10^10^10^10 is a whole number too and more smaller than the others. In others words, if want to get the first whole number (by convenience let's use the number line from the smaller to the higher number). If we put the whole numbers in a number line the smaller approaches to the negative infinity. Then not have the "first whole number" because the set of whole numbers is infinity in both sides has no beginning and no end. Only the set of natural number have a beginning but not have end. The smaller natural number is 0 because you can count 0 things in a set.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            -2 is also a whole number .   The convention is that 0 is not a natural number, except in France.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: Just 10?
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Count the number of squares on a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10 * 10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" chess board."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Try a Continuation Of this Problem."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The number Of Squares in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n*n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Square is "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{1}^{2}+{2}^{2}+{3}^{2}+.......{n}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{1}^{2}+{2}^{2}+{3}^{2}+.......{n}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac {n(n+1)(2n+1)}{6}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Putting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , We get 385 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ddot\smile"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Enjoy!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/GRHOXR2eLK-akshithabcd.JPG?width=1200"}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By using the above formula and putting n= 10, we get , 385."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let no. of squares be n, then by the formula
f(n) = n * (n + 1) * (2 * n + 1) / 6
the answer is 385."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10? That's Easy #2
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the number of 5x5 squares in a 10x10 square."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"One way to see this is this:
There are six ways to place a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5×5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" square on a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10×10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" base."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are also six ways to choose where to place it vertically."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since both these events are independant the number of ways is
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6×6= \boxed {36}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"General Form:- "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The Number of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n*n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Squares in a "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k*k"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Square is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{(k-n+1)}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Putting "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"k=10"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", We get 36 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\ddot\smile"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Enjoy!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 10th class problem for 12th class students
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the area bounded by y=x^2,   y=-(x^2), x=y^2 and x=-(y^2).No other details."}]}]}

title: 10th Problem 2016
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"What is the quadratic formula for the equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ax^2 + bx + c = 0 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"? "}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check out the set: 2016 Problems","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof of the Quadratic Formula: "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The original equation is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ax^2 + bx + c = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Subtract the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on both sides so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ax^2 + bx = -c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Divide the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by all terms so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2 + (\frac {b}{a})x = -\frac {c}{a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Take half the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" term  and square it so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac {b}{2a} \rightarrow \frac {b^2}{4a^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Add the squared term on both sides so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2 + (\frac {b}{a})x + \frac {b^2}{4a^2} = -\frac {c}{a} + \frac {b^2}{4a^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simplify the RHS so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2 + (\frac {b}{a})x + \frac {b^2}{4a^2} = -\frac {4ac}{4a^2} + \frac {b^2}{4a^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Convert the LHS to square form so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x+\frac {b}{2a})^2 = \frac {b^2 - 4ac}{4a^2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Square root both sides so  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x+\frac { b }{ 2a } =\pm \sqrt { \frac { { b }^{ 2 }-4ac }{ 4{ a }^{ 2 } }  } =\quad \frac { \pm \sqrt { { b }^{ 2 }-4ac }  }{ 2a }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Solve for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = -\frac { b }{ 2a } \pm \frac { \sqrt { { b }^{ 2 }-4ac }  }{ 2a }  = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
